channel.title: ML on AesVoy
channel.description: Recent content in ML on AesVoy

item.title: DeepFake Detection Methods
item.description: In this blog post, we explore the topic of image generators and their detection techniques. I’ll discuss various methods for detecting image generators and their manipulations. These include analyzing the visual content of an image, examining its metadata, and using machine learning algorithms to identify patterns in the data.

item.title: From CNNs to Vision Transformers: The Future of Image Recognition
item.description: Vision Transformers (ViTs) are redefining image recognition by using Transformer models to capture global context, unlike traditional Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) that focus on local features. ViTs excel with large datasets and show impressive scalability and performance.

item.title: imageNet-Computer Vision Backbone
item.description: ImageNet is more than just a dataset. The sheer scale of ImageNet, combined with its detailed labeling, made it essentially the backbone of Computer Vision.

item.title: Transformers & Attention
item.description: This blog post explains how self-attention and softmax function in Transformer models, crucial for modern NLP. It breaks down how self-attention helps models understand relationships between tokens and how softmax ensures efficient computation and numerical stability.

item.title: Diffusion VS Auto-Regressive Models
item.description: Generative AI has come a long way, producing stunning images from simple text prompts. But how do Diffusion and Auto-Regressive models work, and why are diffusion models preferred.

item.title: AlexNet Revolution
item.description: In 2012, the field of artificial intelligence witnessed a seismic shift. The catalyst for this transformation was a deep learning model known as AlexNet.

item.title: Generative Adversarial Network
item.description: A neural network is like a highly sophisticated, multi-layered calculator that learns from data. It consists of numerous “neurons” (tiny calculators) connected in layers, with each layer performing a unique function to help the network make predictions or decisions.

item.title: Variational-Auto-Encoder
item.description: The beauty of VAEs lies in their ability to generate new samples by randomly sampling vectors from this known region and then passing them through the generator part of our model.

item.title: Auto-Encoder
item.description: An autoencoder begins its journey by compressing input data into a lower dimension. It then endeavors to reconstruct the original input from this compressed representation.

item.title: Less is More Paper Review
item.description: Less is More: Parameter-Free Text Classification with Gzip offers a novel text classification method using gzip compression, eliminating manual parameter tuning.

item.title: Infini-Attention Paper Review
item.description: Infini-Attention introduces a novel approach to scaling Transformer models for infinitely long inputs while managing memory and computation.

item.title: Softmax
item.description: Softmax stands as a pivotal component in neural network architectures, offering a means to convert raw scores into interpretable probabilities.
